Web Resources      Library Databases      Legislative Information      Executive Branch Information      Public Policy Research Guide      FDLP Basic Collection      FDLP Partnerships      Chicago Government Information           Federal Depository Library Program      This library is a congressionally designated depository for U.S. Government documents. Public access to the government documents collection is guaranteed by public law. (Title 44 United States Code)                       Gateways to Government Information      USA.gov  USA.gov creates and organizes timely, needed government information and services and makes them accessible to the public anytime, anywhere, via their channel of choice.    GovInfo.Gov  govinfo is a service of the United States Government Publishing Office (GPO), which is a Federal agency in the legislative branch.  govinfo provides free public access to official publications from all three branches of the Federal Government.    CyberCemetery: University of North Texas Government Information Connection  The CyberCemetery is an archive of government websites that have ceased operation (usually websites of defunct government agencies and commissions that have issued a final report).   more...  less...   This collection features a variety of topics indicative of the broad nature of government information. In particular, this collection features websites that cover topics supporting the university’s curriculum and particular program strengths.    LLMC-Archive of Government Information  LLMC is a non-profit cooperative of libraries dedicated to the twin goals of, preserving legal titles and government documents, while making copies inexpensively available digitally through its on-line service LLMC-Digital. LLMC provides libraries with a reliable and budget-friendly source of digital replacement when their older, physically deteriorating books became too burdensome to store given diminished use. While aiding libraries in their preservation and space recovery programs, it also provides an economical way to complete retrospective collections.    FDLP Web Archive  Archived Web sites from the federal government, regularly updated and stored.    Illinois State Documents on Hathi Trust  This collection includes Illinois state documents received through the Illinois State Library’s Document Depository Program. The Secretary of State and Illinois State Library allow all Illinois State documents fully accessible in the HathiTrust.           Federal Information: Selected Sites      A-Z Index of Government Departments and Agencies     Code of Federal Regulations     Federal Register     Patent Full Text Database     The American Presidency Project (UCSB)     Compilation of Presidential Documents     Department of State Treaty Information     Vital Records by State            International & Foreign Government      CIA World Factbook  The CIA World Factbook provides a wide range of information about individual countries around the world, from economic indicators to flags of the countries.  It is updated every two weeks.    US Embassies Site  This site includes the websites of US embassy missions around the world.    A-Z List of Country and other Area Pages (U.S. Department of State)     Global Gateway: World Culture and Resources (Library of Congress)     United Nations     NGO Branch: United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs     The World Bank            Census Data      Census Data  Official U.S. site of data from the last census. See also: Historical Statistics of the U.S.  elsewhere in this guide.   more...  less...   Official U.S. census data viewable in a variety of formats. See also: Historical Statistics of the U.S. (Millennial edition), elsewhere in this guide.      U.S. Census Bureau Archive       Historical Statistics of the United States, Millennial ed.  Quantitative facts about American history. Provides downloadable data sets, with introductions and analysis by experts.   more...  less...   Historical Statistics of the U.S. (Millennial Edition, published 2006) presents quantitative historical information covering population, work and welfare, economic structure and performance, governance, and international relations, from earliest time to the present.      Integrated Public Use Microdata Sets  IPUMS-USA is a project dedicated to collecting and distributing United States census data.           State and Local Governing Associations      Institutional Institute of Municipal Clerks     National Association of Counties     National League of Cities     National League of State Legislatures     The United States Conference of Mayors       Illinois Blue Books  Illinois Blue Books are comprehensive sources of information about Illinois' executive, judicial and legislative branches of government.   more...  less...   The Illinois Blue Book is one of the most comprehensive sources of state government information. It is a nationally recognized source for information about Illinois' executive, judicial and legislative branches of government. Originating in 1861 as a privately published roster of legislators, the Blue Book has evolved into a historical publication complete with biographies, articles, illustrative photographs and helpful information for Illinois citizens. Recent issues of the Blue Book also include lists of toll-free state telephone numbers and updated listings for Illinois news media - including contact information.
